title: error E0283 "type annotations required" in where clause

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The following code (generated by a macro) does not compile:

```
fn test<'a, 'b>(a: &'a i32, b: &'b i32) 
where &'a i32: Copy, &'b i32: Copy
{}
```
([playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=038030d9efb49c8b2ccb6c5555758f2e))

Output:

```
error[E0283]: type annotations required: cannot resolve `&'a i32: std::marker::Copy`
 --> src/lib.rs:2:1
  |
2 | / fn test<'a, 'b>(a: &'a i32, b: &'b i32) 
3 | | where &'a i32: Copy, &'b i32: Copy
4 | | {}
  | |__^
  |
  = note: required by `std::marker::Copy`
```

The error message seems a bit weird to me, as I don't see where type annotations could be added.
Note that in this particular case the bounds are trivial, but since the code is generated by a macro I can't get rid of them easily.

The error also happens with a type parameter, as in:
```
fn test<'a, 'b, T>(a: &'a T, b: &'b T) 
where &'a T: Send, &'b T: Send
{}
```
([playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=9e8ca1b479986a4f9ff81a2a26163d41))

Also, this code (replaced the lifetime of the second bound) compiles without errors:

```
fn test<'a, 'b>(a: &'a i32, b: &'b i32) 
where &'a i32: Copy, &'a i32: Copy
{}
```
